alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 9:25AM PDT until August 11 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas around Humboldt Bay. Hide tide is predicted to be 8.17 feet at the North Spit tide gauge around 11 PM this evening, and tidal anomalies have been running up to 0.7 foot above predicted values. Minor flooding is possible when tide levels reach 8.8 feet. * WHERE...Around Humboldt Bay, including King Salmon and possibly into Jackson Ranch Road. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King Salmon is the most likely to observe minor flooding around high tide tonight and Thursday night. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.
